content: janne yoga socks by quasigerade janne yoga socks are a dk weight yoga sock pattern the special thing about yoga socks is the fact that they don t have a heel or tip this allows you to have a good grip to your yoga mat while still having warm feet another benefit is that having no heel or tip makes yoga socks the perfect project for beginner knitters © 2023 isabella helms this pattern is for private use only it is not allowed to be copied resold or passed on selling pieces that were knitted following this pattern is prohibited materials 3 5 mm double pointed needles or circular needles if you prefer to knit your socks with the magic loop technique approximately 50 g of dk weight sock yarn you can also use two strands of fingering weight sock yarn shown in the picture above are one strand of merino twist sock by kiezgarn in the colorway coco and one strand of arwetta classic by filcolana 1 darning needle to weave in any loose ends 1 stitch marker to mark the beginning of the round sizes the pattern comes in one size which works for most european sizes eu 37 42 but you can always choose to cast on less or more stitches if you know from prior sock knitting experience that a stitch count of 48 stitches does not work for your feet the total amount of stitches should be divisible by 4 the length of the sock is customizable gauge 22 sts x 32 r = 10 cm x 10 cm washed and blocked in stockinette stitch abbreviations st s stich es r - row k knit p purl sks slip 1 st as if to knit k1 then slip the slipped st over the knit st k2tog knit two sts together instructions cast on 48 sts work 10 rounds in 1 x 1 ribbing i e *k1 p1* and repeat from * to * until the end of the round make sure to place a stitch marker to mark the beginning of the round now continue working in stockinette stitch until your sock measures at least 16 cm the longer you make the leg of your sock the slouchier and cozier the result will be * in the next round work half of the stitches in a round so 24 sts in stockinette stitch and the remaining sts in 1 x 1 ribbing * repeat from * to * another 3 times in the next round work 24 sts in stockinette stitch and then bind off the remaining 24 sts in the round using an elastic bind-off method binding off these sts will create the hole for our heel so good news we don t have to knit the heel and just skip it in the next round work 24 sts in stockinette stitch and then cast on 28 new sts the extra 4 sts allow for a little bit extra room for our heel from
